As you are aware, the Government of India have consistently declined to recognise Con sular Officers in India elsewhere than at seaport towns. This policy has been adopted in the case of all European and Asiatic nations, but, in view of our treaties with Persia, it might be difficult to resist a claim for consular representation at an inland place, should it be pressed on the grounds of trade interests. titleInfo.title: File 868/1904 Pt 4 'Consular: Persia; desire of Persia to appoint a Consular Officer at Mandalay'

mods.abstract: Part 4 contains correspondence between the consul General for Persia in India, the Persian Legation in London, the Consul General for Persia in India, the Foreign Office, and the India Office, regarding the proposed appointment of a Persian Vice Consul at Mandalay. The proposal was rejected by the Government of India, because the presence of a Vice Consul at Rangoon (Yangon, Myanmar) was enough.
